content: In Haskell, when you're writing a complicated function that has multiple pieces of functionality, it's often useful to break out those pieces of functionality into several complicated functions introduced by a where clause. Lean doesn't seem to have this syntax, just let. Is this a principled and deliberate syntax decision, or did no one get around to implementing where clauses?
oh so there is a where syntax
just wasn't documented in a place I could find
